1322111112111111.content:
Henriette was quietly surprised at the cub's decision. After spending so much time in her mouth and even going for a brief trip into her belly, he wanted more? Her voracious side was overjoyed. She prepared to eat him once again when Simba raised a paw. She paused, curious what the little lion wanted.

"If I can make one teensy request though... could you swallow me quickly? I'm too tired to put up much of a struggle in your mouth anymore, and I know how much you like that. I just don't want to disappoint you." The cub lied through his teeth, hoping to hit a soft spot with his captor.

"You should've thought of that before trying to escape. Nevertheless, I am quite tired too, so I'll keep it short." She replied, opening her maw expectantly.

There was no way around this. The little lion gulped as he cautiously walked towards the large mouth. Strands of saliva hung from the ceiling, further reinforcing the powerful resistance Simba felt with every step. Every fiber of his body urged him not to do it, but he knew that much worse would await him if he chickened out right now. From what he'd gleaned the hippo's stomach was effectively harmless to him, and while she slept it would be a lot more protected then being squashed flat under her belly. Henriette expected the cub to have some difficulty following up on his words and showed some patience. However, the moment he set a paw in her mouth it snapped shut like a bear trap. With ease she slurped the remainder of his dangling body inside.

Her tongue was ready for action and quickly wrapped itself around Simba for a little squeeze. Henriette murred as even in his fatigued state she managed to squish some desperate struggles out of him. The meaty tongue threw the ragdoll of a lion around a few times, slamming him into the sides of the hippo's mouth after each throw. After just a few throws she tilted her head up and opened her maw, allowing the cub one last look outside as he slid downwards towards her hungry gullet. In a flash it gulped down half of his body and a second loud gulp sent him to his slimy sleeping bag.

The stomach of the hippo was in the exact same state he left it in. The dry stench of digesting plant matter with the overwhelming aroma of her freshly applied coat of saliva did remarkably little for Simba. He feared he was already getting used to the horrid stench on her inside. Though that may be a blessing, considering he'd be stuck with this voracious hippo for the foreseeable future. The walls that pushed and churned him earlier today were a lot calmer in the evening. The cub felt the hippo lie down in her bed, as far as Simba could consider the patch of squashed reeds a bed. His chamber was spacious enough, had air and was soundproof on all sides with a thick layer of hippo fat. The little lion got ready for the night and settled himself on the edge of the stomach, keeping out of the pool of stomach juices in the middle as much as possible. Sleep proved hard, but the day's events had left him bruised and knackered. He fell asleep pretty much the moment he laid down.

The next day...

"Unless you've learned how to live without air, I'd scoot a little to the side. I don't want you to suffocate, I'm not thát horrible." She said with a comforting smile. Then it was time for Henriette to sleep. She stood over the little lion and basically just dropped all of herself down at once. Simba gasped at the sudden amount of mass enveloping almost his entire body. Her jiggly gut rested on his back, flattening his whole body a little. This time around he knew sort of what to expect, but he was still taken aback by the hippo's immense weight. At least his head stayed clear, allowing him to breathe. A pang of dread shot through him as he feared for a moment she could roll over, but he remembered the first night. She had been right, and never moved an inch all night. Simba didn't quite understand how she could perform such a feat, but with the help of her giant gut, he as sure he would match it tonight. He calmed himself down and settled in for the night.

Dawn had only just broken and Henriette was already waking up. Yesterday's game of chasing the little lion around had left her muscles sore. She groggily looked around, seeming to have forgotten she like right next to a field of mud pits. With a sleepy smile she sauntered over to their bubbly goodness. In her still partly-sleeping state she hadn't noticed yet, but Henriette was carrying a passenger.

Simba had spent a full night stuck underneath the hippo's sizeable belly. Its weight was immense, but eventually he did fall asleep. During the night Henriette's belly moulded itself around him, slightly reducing the burden he had to bear and pressing the two of them together for hours to come. The result was almost comical. The little cub was stuck to her belly, still asleep. As her pudgy gut swayed gently from side to side so did Simba, still happily dreaming of a world where he was getting squashed by a hippo.

Between the two of them there was about enough active thought going on to power a sloth, but Henriette was mostly focused on soothing her aching frame. She carefully sat down next to the pools and reached a toe in. The mud was perfect, the network of steam geysers running through the earth keeping it at a constant pleasant warmth. She slowly slid herself into the pool when the hippo finally noticed her little passenger, still asleep. She smiled at the cub and thought about what it must've looked like for her to walk to the pool with him still glued to her gut. She giggled a little, causing her belly to shudder.

Between her having slept on top of him and the events of yesterday Henriette felt like the cub could use a mud bath too. And just like that she cooked up another little game for the situation. Seemingly unconcerned about the lion, she lowered herself further into the pool as planned. Her shaking gut had apparently stirred the cub out of his sleep, but he was still far from awake. The warm touch of mud against his body did considerably more to wake him. He barely grasped what was going on by the time he was already half submerged into the bubbling dirt. He looked around in a panic, feeling the mud engulf him more and more. He looked Henriette in the eye, but all she did was wave at him as he vanished into the mud. Simba had taken a deep breath and was beginning to clue in to what was happening. He had to pull himself free from her belly and struggle his way to the surface quickly before she pulled him down too deep.

The squirming and fighting felt great to Henriette, who loved feeling the little lion fight her body. The bond her sweaty belly and the lion's body had formed proved difficult to loosen. Simba being buried in mud didn't help much either. She was content to watch a little longer and see what'd happen, but the cub had far less enthusiasm for this scenario. He fought mightily, slowly peeling himself off of the hippo's gut. How well does he do?

Simba's lungs were on their last legs. Was he really going to drown in a mudbath, stuck to a fat, sweaty belly? He could feel it jiggle and shake, and he knew it was probably that evil hippo laughing at him. Suddenly he felt something else stir in the mud, and a strong hand grabbed his tail. He was yanked back up. The strong arm lifting him had no problem tearing him free from the belly and pulling him out of the mud. The moment he broke the surface he took a deep breath. Precious air flooded his systems, along with the grimy taste of the dirt around his mouth. He didn't care though. He was safe, for now. He rubbed the mud from his eyes and looked at his saviour.

The hippo was about to burst, and the look of a mud-drenched cub looking up to her was the final straw. She erupted in laughter, thinking about how pathetic the cub had been. Underneath all the dirt, Simba was red with embarrassment. "Hahahaha, you were stuck to my belly... and you couldn't even pull free... I almost drowned you, just taking a bath! Hahahaha." Slowly her laughter petered out as the cub simply waited for her to release him. After a few more minutes she hoisted him to her side and casually dropped him into the mud. He landed with a small splash, and quickly found himself having little difficulty staying afloat in the dense mud.

"Take it easy, cub. These pools are great for sore muscles, and I'm guessing that after yesterday's events you've got plenty of those to spare."

With him no longer in mortal peril, the aching muscles did come back to the forefront. She was right, yesterday was rough.

"Just relax and let the warm mud do its work. I know I'm needing it. It's not often my prey gives me that much of a workout." She said, and for the first time, Simba talked to her with something more then a desperate plea.

"It's easy to run when there's a hungry hippo right behind you."

"True, but you didn't just panic. You were still thinking clear, using the terrain to slow me."

"Not that it did much good." Simba sulked.

"Come now, you avoided me well enough that I'm still feeling my muscles burn from it. Most toys don't leave that big an impression. For all the laughs I have at your expense, I do like having you around."

"Yeah, I still have the chewing to remind me of that." Simba replied, afraid for a moment he'd gotten a little too sassy with her.

"That was probably a bit excessive, sorry. But I needed to show you I don't take escape attempts lightly."

The cave shook as she landed, the lion letting out a loud wheeze as all the air was squashed from his lungs. Henriette stood up, the flattened lion coming up with her. She held onto him again, giving her sister a wink.

Michelle nodded and grabbed the cub. She set him down beside her and rushed towards her sister. When they were about to collide both hippos threw their bellies forward, connecting with a heavy bwomp. Scar disappeared almost completely between them, only his head still visible as he was put through the wringer. When the two separated he fell to the ground.

"You were right, Simba, he is a scrawny one." Henriette mused.

Scar was left at their mercy, what do the hippos do?
13424122211211.title: They squash all opposition until only Scar is left

134241222112112.content:
Henriette's belly rumbled. All that squashing was hard work and she was ravenous. Looking around the cavern it was clear there was little worth eating here. Some hyenas still lay scattered about, crushed unconscious during the brawl. She quickly scanned to see if that one spineless little twat was around that tried to ignore her threats. He'd make for a tasty morsel. But it seemed like he'd ran off again, hopefully for good this time. Suddenly, a different idea sprang to mind. None of the hyena's looked very appetizing, but she can't remember the last time she ate a lion...

"Hey Simba..." She cooed with the sweetest voice she could manage.

Michelle saw what her sister had in mind and grabbed the cub off her shoulder. It was almost hilariously difficult as he had grabbed hold firmly during the brawl, desperate not to get thrown off and end up in the middle of those hyenas. Or worse yet, beneath one of the hippos as they dealt with the hyenas.

"It's okay, the fight's over, you can let go now." Michelle spoke soothingly, stroking the little lion's back.

Finally Simba took a long breath, forcing his body into action and letting go of the hippo's shoulder. He was quickly wrapped up in a flabby hug by Michelle, who eagerly wanted to show him what her sister was up to.

The cub was treated to the wondrous sight of Henriette holding Scar in a choke-hold, his futile flailing slowly weakening as she wrenched her strong arms around his neck. With crushing force she knocked the older lion out cold, letting him flop onto the floor when the job was done. It didn't need a lot of effort after that devastating double belly slam earlier. But Simba's eyes widened with horror as he saw what the next step in her plan was.

The hippo licked her chops and grabbed Scar's head, opening her maw wide before placing it inside. She could fit his head and half his chest into that drooling cavern before closing her jaws around the defeated lion. Having been trapped inside that maw himself, Simba winced at the display. A low slurping sound echoed through the cave as Henriette suckled on her prey. She reared back her head, holding Scar's limp body up and letting gravity assist her. A deep gulp sent his head down her gullet and more quickly followed. She had to be fast so she wouldn't choke on her meal, but this wasn't the first big morsel going into her belly and it wouldn't be the last.

Simba stared in disbelief as he watched his uncle sink down into the hippo's throat. He wished nothing more than for that murderous traitor to suffer, but this just felt wrong. There was little he could do about it now. It's not like Henriette was going to listen to him to begin with. And worse yet, she'd probably want a different lion to eat instead, and the cub was the only one around. He just hung there in Michelle's embrace as he watched the last of Scar's legs slide past those thick lips. He was such a substantial meal for her that the little lion was certain he saw the hippo's belly swell up. The final few gulps seemed the most stressful for Henriette, but at long last she had worked all of the lion down her neck and could breathe freely once more.

"Aaaaaah. That was a real treat. Your uncle might be evil, but he was no less tasty. Reminded me a bit of you, actually." She mused aloud, chuckling a little at the cub's disgusted look. He didn't need more reminders of the time he almost ended up in that belly himself.

"Well, the king's gone... Now what?" Michelle asked, holding the cub up to eye-level and expecting an answer.

"Now I can claim my throne and rule this land as is my right." Simba responded proudly.

"And the other lions would follow a cub?"

"They'd help me out, but they'll recognize that I'm Mufasa's son and with that the rightful ruler of Pride Rock." The cub's tone got a little more haughty as he discussed these royal matters. Henriette just rolled her eyes.

"So as ruler, could you order things to help us?" She asked inquisitively.

"Such as?" The cub was curious to hear what the hippo had in mind.

"Well, first dibs at the watering hole for saving the king sounds fair. Maybe force those hyenas to enter the ring against us for entertainment, I'm sure you can think of a few things." Michelle chimed in. But as the gears in her head turned, Henriette began to think on a far more ambitious scale.

"Say sister, I just thought of something."

"What is it, sis?" Michelle responded. Simba didn't like the tone of the hippo's voice. He had a gut feeling things were about to get a whole lot worse.

"Where is it written that a lion should rule Pride Rock? Since we overthrew the last king, doesn't that make us the rightful owners of this place?" Henriette pondered aloud, putting a broad smile on her sister's face.

"You know, I think you might be right. We should get the word out to our family. They've been looking for a new place to crash and this one might actually be big enough for the lot of them."

"Hey! You can't do this!" Simba cried out. "You promised me you'd put me back on the throne!"

"I promised to overthrow your uncle Scar. And judging by his current predicament I'd say that's a job well done." Henriette gave her jiggling gut a big pat. "And I suppose you've been in charge of the place for a good few minutes, but I think Pride Rock needs someone a little... bigger to run it properly."

Simba couldn't believe it. These fat beasts were talking as gleefully about removing him from his position of power as they were about putting him there to begin with. He'd never even sat on the throne before getting chucked right off it again. But what could he do? The last lion that stood against them was now in Henriette's belly and he wasn't about to start a fight with them. Michelle could feel him wriggle nervously and tried to soothe the cub.

"It's okay, Simba. We're not gonna kick you out. We're not monsters like that. You can stay with us. After all, without you we wouldn't even be here."

"Too right, sis. Besides, that little lion is gonna love it here. He'll make for a great...
134241222112112.title: A belly fit for a king

choices: Scar is waiting for Simba, hungry for vengeance
Scar is already gone, the cub is too soon after
Scar is gone, but the stomach doesn't affect Simba
1342412221121121.content:
The cub's panicked struggles amplified tenfold when Henriette told him of her plans to eat him too. Michelle pulled him closer into her chest, crushing any resistance whilst arguing with her sister.

"C'mon sis, I only just met the little guy. How are you still hungry after that last lion anyway?"

"Did you see him? He was all skin and bones. I want something a little more juicy than that. And that cub is exactly what my belly is longing for." She responds, licking her chops with glee. "Besides, once the family is here he'll end up in someone's belly before the sun has set, you know this."

Michelle found it hard to argue that one. Their family's voracious tendencies were well known and one of the big reasons the other animals gave them a wide berth at the watering hole. Those that strayed close were oftentimes toyed with or swallowed outright. Henriette could see her sister thinking it over, but she didn't seem convinced yet.

"Tell you what. After the family gets here I'll go out and get you a lion to toy with. An adult one that isn't quite as helpless. Or if you're after something small and cute, I'm sure Simba's dumb little friends are around here somewhere."

"Ugh, fine. There's no arguing with you when you're like this. Just promise me you won't chew on him." Michelle huffed, handing the cub over to her sister.

"This little thing? If I can work his entire uncle down whole he shouldn't be a problem." Henriette gave an amused smirk before lifting the cub up over her head and opening her maw wide. The overpowering hug Michelle had given him had left Simba worn out, unable to put up much resistance. But when he saw the pink abyss below him he mustered every ounce of fight he had left in him. It mattered little to the hippo, her tongue twitching a little with excitement as she milked the moment. Her grip on the cub was unwavering and before long he'd tired himself out. Michelle gave him a shy little wave goodbye.

Finally Henriette let go of her prey and sent the cub plummeting into her jaws. Before she could even close her maw around him Simba had already slipped halfway down her gullet. The hungry hippo savoured the taste as best she could before another swallow sent most of the cub down her neck. With a final muffled gulp Simba felt himself enter free fall, pushed down the bottomless cramped throat of the hippo. How Scar had managed to fit through here was a mystery. In the background he could hear her heavy heartbeat and muffled voices. It sounded like the two were discussing something again. What they were arguing about mattered little to Simba. The cub had resigned himself to the bitter fact that his last moments would be inside the hippo's stomach.

"Unbelievable, you greedy guts, you barely even tasted him." Michelle joked.

"I tasted him plenty in the ring and you saw it, he practically slid down my throat before I could do anything. Little bastard almost seemed like he wanted to be in there."

The two hippos sat back and laughed. They'd get the rest of the family over here soon enough. For now it was time to enjoy the spoils of their conquest.

Inside of Henriette's belly, the cub wasn't having nearly such a good time. He just reached the end of the esophagus and splashed down in the large stomach. She pats her gut contently, letting it work on its prey.
1342412221121121.title: royal dessert

13424122211211211.content:
The narrow, slimy tunnel pushed Simba along. His destination was inevitable as he slipped deeper into Henriette's big body with each passing second. But as the final stretch opened up before him the cub saw the one thing that would make his stay in the hippo's stomach even worse.

Filling up most of the cramped space was Scar, curled up in the fetal position. His mane was matted down with stomach slime, the rest of his fur not faring much better. His eyes were half-closed and he seemed almost peaceful, having accepted his fate. A peace rudely shattered as he looked up to see the cub getting deposited in with him.

"You... You..." He muttered angrily, struggling to put his fury into words. "You did this! You brought these horrors to my lair! Did you really think they'd obey you, you stupid little whelp?! Because of you I'm going to spend the last few hours of my life wasting away inside a hippo's stomach!"

Simba was unable to get in a response before Scar wrapped both hands around his neck. The confines of Henriette's belly were roomy enough to hold the both of them, but little more. There was nowhere to run, nowhere to hide for the little lion as his uncle pulled him up to his face. The larger lion's toothy grin widened as he opened his maw wide. He would only have one last opportunity for vengeance and he was damn well gonna take it. He would deny that fat hippo the chance to digest the cub and do it himself!

"Scar! NO!" Was all the cub could cry out before his head was shoved into the yawning maw. Scar had to fight the urge to bite down on his nemesis. Sharp teeth brushed all along the cub's sides as he slipped in deeper. The hungering gullet opened wide and accepted the little lion's head, pulling it in further with a loud gulp. Simba's flailing limbs were restrained and held down against his body as the evil lion swallows more of him. If Henriette's throat was narrow, this one proved nearly impossible to get through. But Scar had never been more determined to beat the odds. He would put that stupid little pest in his place, even if it's the last thing he did.

Several more strained gulps and the cub had been reduced to a pair of flailing feet slowly sinking down the ravenous gullet. Scar felt a little nauseous trying to swallow something that large whole. But as he felt Simba move inside him he knew it was worth it. For years he'd daydreamed about ridding himself of the cub. He'd thought about drowning him, beating him to death, even throwing him off the same cliff as his father. But given his predicament, swallowing the cub whole seemed like the most poetic piece of justice he could imagine. He wasn't gonna escape this belly and judging by the tingling goop in his fur those juices would do their thing soon enough.

As what little air was present began to run out the larger lion's eyelids grew heavy. He knew he wouldn't wake up from this, but with his thirst for vengeance sated he closed his eyes. His last thoughts were of the little cub now squirming in his belly.

Neither lion was ever heard from again and Michelle and Henriette kept their word. As soon as their family arrived they took over Pride Rock. The few lions with enough backbone to stand up against these usurpers quickly had those bones flattened underneath a hippo butt. Those that resisted still were given the same treatment as Scar. With that grim message sent the hippos were now in charge of the Savannah. Though they demanded food, the other animals seemed relieved to have a change in leadership. That relief would fade as the corruption set in. With absolute power the hippos began to run the place as they saw fit. Animals were judged mostly by how hungry the hippos were for a snack and those that weren't eaten were sent into the wrestling ring to face however many hippos it would take to make the fight completely one-sided. No-one dared complain though as Henriette frequently regaled them with stories of the little cub that made it all happen, patting her belly as she told the conclusion.
13424122211211211.title: Scar is waiting for Simba, hungry for vengeance

13424122211211213.content:
Simba's body slowly curled up into the tight, hot stomach as the acids bubbled around his pelt of fur, remaining harmless even as the rest of his body was deposited from the esophagus. He finally opened his eyes to the sight of complete darkness, the sensations of the stomach-churning around the lion cub as his legs slid into the humid cavern. He sloshed about within the stomach, his paws slightly pressing out against the stomach’s walls in confusion as to why there was no burning sensation. The cub though that he was either dreaming or excruciating lucky. A sigh echoed within the confines of the hippo's stomach as Henriette swayed her hips, watching her bulging gut sway about, the meal within that was Simba being helplessly thrown around.

The predator hippo blushes as pleasure flowed through her veins from the movements her temporary prey made. The liquid within the stomach rose to Simba's neck and knees as he curled into a rough ball, the stomach walls constricting tight around his body. The apparent acids around the lion cub continued to bubble harmlessly, the sensations of it beginning to relax him alongside the warmth slowly. From the slow groans of the belly and the occasional gurgling sound, everything felt pleasant and relaxing, a stark contrast to the onslaught of fear and panic he was having earlier. The cub's eyes began to droop as he grew tired, the quiet and gentle swaying of the stomach further coaxing the lion to sleep.

Even if he had any desire to continue staying awake, the lion's body refused as the acids, belly sounds, and gentle movements relaxed his form until it was limp. Once he'd grown unable to move, his eyes shut, and sleep quickly overcame his senses. The world remains just as pitch black as it already was.



Light erupted into Simba's vision with disturbing haste, interrupting his slumber, and forcing the cub's paws to his eyes. "You're finally awake, huh? Hope you had a good sleep~." The imposing, authoritative voice of the new Queen of the Pridelands boomed in Simba's awakening mind. He surveyed his surroundings and saw he was no longer inside Henriette's stomach, but perched atop her heaving chest. Calm, deep breaths ruffled his fur, not even a trace of liquid upon it, as she smiles over his tired form. "What, you didn't think I'd digest you, right?" She chuckles at the puzzled look the lion cub was giving her.

"Why shouldn't I've thought that?" Simba scowls with a hiss, catching Henriette by surprise. "You digested Scar; you digested him so fast there wasn't anything left of him by the time you decided to eat me. So...why didn't you?" The hippo's eyes fluttered as she breathed out a more substantial, sad sigh.

"I guess I deserve that. You must have gone through quite the scare earlier, huh? Well, there are two big reasons why you're still around to talk to me." She sets the Lion cub down onto the floor of the cavern in Pride Rock. How long had he been out? Had the hippos even left the place since they took over? "One, your too tasty to be eaten just once, us Hippos love our food and your one the most lovably delicious snacks I've had in a long time, and I'm sure my family will agree. Second, well, is it so hard to believe that I like having you around?"

"Kind of, yeah?" Simba frowned as he kept checking for bits of drool or acid his fur might have sustained from being inside of the hippo's stomach. "All I am to you is a bit of food, or a seat, or a pet. You took me over to Pride Rock not to make me King, but so you could take over my home and my people! I can't-I..." The would-be King suddenly couldn't deal with all the horrible emotions he was lumping on to his tired brain and fell to the hard, cold floor of the cavern.

Before Simba had a chance to cry, Henriette shook her head sadly and lifted him by the scruff of his neck. "Simba, look at me." She said in a stern voice. With not much say in the matter, he obeyed. "Simba, I know you think I'm a monster, but I'm not. I digested Scar killed Scar because he was. I didn't kill you because you're a kid, and if two hippos won't let a kid be king, do you think the rest of the Savannah will, eighter."

"B-but..." The Lion cub sniffled, struggling to remember his Father's words. "But my dad said that all the lands that the light touches belong to-"

"Simba...he's gone." Henriette interrupted him. "This is going to be hard to hear, but I don't put much stock in dead people's words. Us hippos have a saying: eat or be eaten. If he were worth hearing, he would still be around. I keep you around because I like it when you talk, along with all those cute little squeals you make when I tease 'ya."

"So...what happens next?" Simba asks, his eyes a little puffy from the tears that were supposed to be flowing if not for Henriette's intervention.

Choice 1: "Your mom was here, earlier, asking for 'ya."

Choice 2: "I think it's time for you to get acquainted with my family~" She grins.

Choice 3: Simba's stomach growls. "First thing is getting you some food."

Choice 4: You might not be king...but I'll let you decide."
13424122211211213.title: Scar is gone, but the stomach doesn't affec...

choices: Henriette's parents decide to torment Simba
Uncle Shawn sneaks by and grabs the cub without them noticing
134241222112112132.content:
"I reckon everyone will be super eager to meet you. Come, I'll introduce you." Henriette draped the cub on her shoulder and wandered back to the main cavern of Pride Rock. Simba wasn't sure what to expect, but soon he was met with a familiar smell. It was burned into the back of his mind after his 'fight' with the hippo. The distinct smell of hippo farts hung in the air, though mercifully faint. Whoever this family was, hygiene didn't seem a high priority to them. As they neared their destination the cub could hear voices. So many voices. How big was this family?

Finally they entered the area and the cub's jaw nearly fell off. A veritable sea of fat, smelly beasts filled the room. All of them were busy talking among eachother. Many were smiling from ear to ear, clearly pleased with their new accommodation. Henriette grinned smugly, speaking to the cub.

"Meet the new royal family. More than you expected, ain't it?"

"Where are the lions? What did you do to them?" The little lion asked with a twinge of panic in his voice. His family wouldn't leave so easily and if Scar was any indication, many of those fat bellies could be stuffed with them now.

"Take it easy. We simply asked them to leave as we were the new rulers thus Pride Rock belonged to us. I'll admit some were more resistant to departing as this had been their home for so long. But most of them just grumbled and growled before heading of. I guess they knew what would happen to those that tried to fight. And as far as those that resisted went... They changed their minds after being sat on for a few hours. The only one that's gone forever is Scar, but I doubt any tears will be shed for him."

Simba breathed a sigh of relief. At least nobody else got killed during this hostile takeover. The hippo enters the crowd and begins to show off the cub to her family.

"Simba, this is my uncle Elmer." She chirps, holding the cub out to a particularly fat hippo. He responds, his foul breath curling the lion's whiskers.

"Nice to meet ya, former prince. Hope ya don't mind us lower creatures takin' over for a while." He laughs. Henriette hastily moves on to more acquaintances.

"That there is uncle Shawn, stay away from him. He's a bit of a pervert." Henriette said in a hushed tone, pointing out a shifty looking hippo. The cub rolled his eyes. After what she'd done to him, she was in no position to call anyone a pervert. "He'll fuck just about anything with a heartbeat." She added, giving Simba the unpleasant mental image of what might happen should the hippo get his hands on him. Almost on cue the hippo shot the cub a lecherous look and grinned creepily.

"Pa, Ma, meet Simba. He's the cub I told you about." She exclaimed happily, turning to a pair of hippos that opened their arms of a big group hug. The cub thought he'd be safe on his perch, but she grabs him by the scruff of his neck and dangles him in front of her. He barely gets out a little scream before three rotund bellies meet, squashing him in the middle. The blubbery masses envelop him completely, squeezing and rolling the lion between them. Greasy sweat matted his fur as the hippos seemed more eager to toy with him than to exchange hugs.

Slowly it sank in to the cub that this was his life now. A toy to be squashed and played with by this family of fat monsters. And from what he'd seen so far, more than a few of these hippos would be 'playing' with him in ways no lion should ever be subjected to. The pervasive stench of lingering farts and stale sweat would become the default and being smothered by bellies and butts was going to be his natural state of being. Assuming none of them wanted to show of their ability to swallow him whole and not digest him again. There was still one ray of hope. These hippos may have overthrown the lions, but would anyone accept them as the new rulers of the Savannah?

Finally the crushing bellies parted and Simba was left to flop onto the ground. The cub was breathing heavily from the overwhelming experience, just laying there and listening to them.

"So? How'd the acceptance speech go?"

"Lots of cheering, I guess they were as happy not having to deal with those lions any more as we were. Even the request to provide an offering of food didn't seem to ruffle any feathers. I suppose when bringing food no longer involves offering up friends and family to be devoured it becomes a lot more palatable." All three hippos laughed, the little lion quietly whimpering in shame. So much for that idle hope. Did anyone in the Savannah like them or were they just afraid of them?

"Anyway, I'm gonna check in on some things. Can you two keep an eye on him for me? If you see Michelle, just hand him off to her. She's been eager to play with him for a while." Henriette looked down and gave the hippo a malicious smirk, knowing exactly the kind of games her sister had in mind.

"Yeah, sure." Her parents replied. Henriette took her leave, abandoning the cub to their care. They barely paid him any attention, continuing to chat with other family members.
134241222112112132.title: Meet the family

1342412221121121321.content:
The many hippos of Henriette and Michelle's extended family freely conversed in Pride Rock's main cavern, talking mainly about all their plans they have for the Savannah now that they have stumbled upon all this power. At the same time, Simba, the lion who should have had all that power, went ignored. The cub pricked his ears up into the air, trying to make out what Pa and Ma were saying over the hiss of the background noise. However, just before he was able to decipher something along the lines of political intrigue, Simba was suddenly lifted from the floor of the cave into the air, face to face with a more familiar pachyderm, Michelle. "Hey, there, kitty-kat~" Henriette's sister cooed as her eyes drank in the cub's fidgeting form. "So, how are you getting along with my folks? They're pretty cool, but watch your step around them, they worked up a mighty appetite coming over here."

The fat hippo playfully smacked her prodigious belly with one hand while holding Simba in the other, the massive organ inside letting out an ominous growl of hunger that sent the cub into another panicky fit. "O-oh, yeah, Michelle, your family is...great." He fibbed with as much of a smile as he could muster. The truth was that he was afraid of the lot of them, with their raunchy behaviors polluting his home. Of course, he couldn't say that. That would guarantee whatever torment they all have planned for him would intensify. "So, um...now that you're all in charge, what's going to happen to the Pride Lands?"

"Aren't you too young for politics, little kitten?" Michelle teased with a smug smile, tucking Simba atop her right shoulder as she made her way outside of the main cavern out onto the precipice that looked over the kingdom. The lion cub was appreciative of the cold wind breezing through his now matted fur; it had gotten stuffy in there with all those hippos marking their new territory. The pachyderm sat strolled to the very tip of the overhanging rock and sat down over the edge, taking in the beauty of the land in the late morning. "Well, if you want to know so much...look out, Simba. What do you see?"

Simba obeyed and followed Michelle's gaze over the Pride Lands, the same Kingdom that Mufasa, his father, promised would be his. "It's...the Savannah. Where everything the light touches belongs-I mean, used to belong to the Lion Pride." The lion cub put bluntly, trying to skirt over the fact that his whole world had changed in the span of a trip to Henriette's stomach. "What do, er, you see, Michelle?"

"Food." The hippo offered just as bluntly, if not more so then Simba did. Her stomach let out another impatient growl as she absentmindedly rubbed it with a content smile on her lips, sounding like Hell's horn to the lion cub. "I see miles and miles of my family's brand new kitchen. Zebras and elephants, antelopes and buffalo, all prime for the taking and looking delicious~.' Michelle licked her lips slowly as she fantasized about all the tasty meals she could have at her leisure, while Simba looked on at her aghast.

"B-but...I thought you promised you wouldn't ask to offer themselves up as food..." Simba protested to Michelle quietly, the hippo craning her neck around to give the little lion a condescending smirk. "I know that you all like to eat, but...can't you just eat fruit and grass, like them?"

"You think I got this big my just mowing down lawns, kitty? No, I need meat, and my family needs meat, and there's so much to eat!" Michelle laughed right in Simba's face, spewing foul-smelling spittle on his fur before taking him down from his perch atop her shoulder. She sat him down atop her grey dome of a stomach instead, the organ inside eager for more nourishment. "Of course, we'll honor the 'letter' of our promise, kind of like me and Henriette honored putting you back on the throne. We won't ask our new subjects to be our food. We won't make requests, not when it comes to the food we eat. Harvest looking a little skimpy? Not a problem, a herd of gazelle is easy to find, and at our size, there's not much a fight they can give us."

Simba shook in terror atop Michelle's stomach as she laid out what exactly was going to happen to the Pride Lands, his old home, in vivid detail. He regretted asking the question in the first place. Lions ate prey, too, like a lot of other predatorial animals in the savannah, but these hippos, to them, this was a sport. "Soon, Simba...you're going to have to get used to your new role in life as our pet." The hippo grinned as she forced the lion cub deep into the surface of her belly, delighting in his little struggles as he tried to push himself up from her grip on his back. "Because if you think we're too much to handle now, I've got some bad news for you. We're only going to get bigger, hungrier, heavier, and needier. Maybe if you're a good kitty, we can talk about getting some of your friends and family to help lighten your workload. Unless you're okay with seeing them as hippo chub."

The lion cub broke down, reaching his emotional limit, as he was forcibly snuggled into Michelle's soft stomach and tears began to well up in his eyes. His mind was filled with horrific images of his mother, Sarabi, going down precisely like Scar did, of Nala being thrown into the same wrestling ring that he found himself in only yesterday. "Michelle...s-stop, please." Simba whimpered. "I'll be a g-g-good kitty, just don't hurt them..."

"Hey, hey, enough with the waterworks..." Michelle brought a hand down to reach Simba's face, wiping away a few fallen tears from his muzzle. "Nothing's happened yet; there's no reason to cry over milk that hasn't even spilled, yeah? Sometimes, I...can get a little carried away with the teasing, it's not fun seeing you like this. All you have to do is be on your best behavior, can you do that for me?" The hippo was still smiling, though her eyes were now contorted with worry.

The lion cub grit his teeth and forced himself not to let any more tears fall, nodding through the flexible stomach blubber to aver Michelle's question. Yes, he can be a cute little pet. He'll get stepped on, used as a seat, get eaten, and be a living toy for the rest of his life, but if it meant securing his family's safety, he'd do all of that and more.

"Good...well, now that I've sated your curiosity about politics and whatnot, let's play a game." The hippo sets Simba off from her belly and down onto the floor of the rock, abruptly ending whatever sobs he still had in his system to get out. "Hide and seek, plain and simple. You hide, and I'll seek. You'll have the advantage since this is all new territory for me. If you stay hidden...uhh, I guess I can take you to your mom, I think. She was asking about you earlier. I guess she was worried."

"You're...serious?" Simba asked. "What happens if you find me?"

Michelle doesn't answer. Instead, she gives Simba a win before she closes both her eyes. "You've got until I get to a hundred. Ready?" No, he wasn't, but the lion didn't have a choice as he began to make a mad dash away from the hippo as she began to count from one.

Where does Simba hide?
1342412221121121321.title: Michelle approaches, taking the cub

choices: Simba won, Michelle takes him to his mother
Simba lost, Michelle plays with him more
Simba won, Michelle takes him to his mother, whom she ate earlier
13424122211211213214.content:
The cub felt a spark of optimism as he bolted away from the fat hippo. For once the deck was stacked in his favor. He mulled over his options. The main room offered a lot of hippos to hide among, but if Michelle's words about their voracious attitudes are anything to go by, his hiding place would end up being inside their bellies. And even if he managed to avoid getting swallowed, they'd give him up the moment Michelle asked them for him. "First off, I think you can agree he's really cute. But can't you see that he's special? He had the bravery to ask me and my sister to help overthrow Scar. I mean, what kind of madman does that? We don't respect much, but that right there shows promise. It also helps that he finally seems to have accepted his place. Obedience is a rare trait among you lions."

Sarabi snarled a little at that final remark, but the hippo didn't care. Michelle knew she was right, wiggling her stubby toes to demand more licking. When the lioness reached in, tongue at the ready, the hippo suddenly leaned in, grabbing the lioness and pulling her closer. In an instant Sarabi found herself between two thick thighs, the blubbery mass encasing all but her head.

"Thankfully, with some effort, even you can be taught." Michelle whispered, malice dripping off her words. She squeezed her victim between her thighs. Having the air crushed from her lungs there was no more than a silent gasp as the lioness was shown her place. She wouldn't hold out against this onslaught for long, but thankfully the hippo decided her message had come across. She relented, letting the lion breathe but keeping her pinned between her thighs.

"Now I don't want to hear another growl, grumble or snarl from you... or else..." The hippo ramped up the pressure, crushing the trapped lion again to thoroughly instill her message. Sarabi grit her teeth, trying not to let the hippo see the pain she was in. But Michelle knew the power hidden in those fatty thighs of her. She'd crushed many things into submission or worse with them. She let the lioness' flop free from its sweaty prison, leaving Sarabi breathing heavy between her legs. Hopefully she'd be a bit more accepting of Michelle as Simba's other mother now. Speaking of the little cub, where did he go? She scanned the water, but didn't see him at first. Like mother, like son it seemed. Michelle already pictured the disobedient cub being taught the same lesson, her crushing thighs smothering him completely. But before she could daydream any further the little lion appeared from behind a bush, completely unaware of the torment his mother had been put through. She beckoned him over.

"Well, I think it's time we head home. By the feel of it, those zebras have left the building, so your room is ready." She gave Sarabi a sly look, the lion letting out a weary sigh and accepting what was about to happen. With no ceremony at all Michelle lifted her up and stuffed her down her throat. Simba looked away, but the wet slurping, squelching and gulping were unmistakable.

"Aaah, still tasty." Michelle smiled, patting her belly and picking the cub up by the scruff of his neck.
134241222112112132143513.title: From one mother to another

1342412221121121321435132.content:
"Wow…" Simba fluttered his eyes as he took in Michelle's form. "D-did you get...bigger?" Yes, she did. In addition to a Hippo's stomach being able to control what it does and doesn't digest, it was brutally efficient in breaking down whatever was unfortunate enough to end up inside. In the time that Simba had to himself playing around the watering hole, the Zebra family that his new mother ate had broken down into a goopy pulp, and by the time Sarabi entered, they weren't even that. There was no mistaking it, however slight the changes were, there was more Michelle now than there was before.

Her stomach protruded farther out; her breasts sagged more heavily, her rear end had more fat to sway, she even looked to be a few inches taller. "Maybe a little," Michelle smirked as she brought the little lion cub closer to her face. "But that just means there's more of me for you to love." Before Simba realized what she was doing, the fat beast parted her maw with a smile and gave her son a lick-kiss. He squirmed a bit at first, asking her to cut it out, but there was no hiding the smile he mirrored or the giggles in between his requests.

Hippo tongues could be quite acrobatic when they wanted to, the fat muscle washing over his paws and premature whiskers, tickling him to no end. When she was done, Simba was still smiling as she deposited him atop her right shoulder. Michelle rose from her seat on the shore of the watering hole before walking back in the direction of Pride Rock. "Um...M-mommy, can I ask you a question?" Simba piped up after some time, earning a lazy eye roll from the hippo as she gave him her attention. To her surprise, the lion cub was blushing slightly now. "Um...what do I taste like?"

"Now, why would you ask a question like that, Kitten? Do you want to be more like me or something?" Michelle probed with a smile, pleasantly unprepared for such a query. Simba squirmed underneath the hippo's gaze, fumbling his paws together as he tried to force the words out of his mouth. "It's hard to describe; that's why I like eating prey. Their flavor is so much more complicated than regular fruit or dead meat. If you want to know, you taste like cherries drowned in cream, with a hint of salt." To this, Michelle gave the cub another lick; this time, the tongue stayed far longer to relish in his distinctive flavor.

"Cherries and salt? Sounds gross." Simba shivered in disgust, but while Michelle kept on trekking to Pride Rock, the wheels in her head began to turn. Simba was adorable as a lion cub, but, in all honesty, also horribly frail. She and the rest of her family were planning on fatter and more substantial from the spoils of their new kingdom, but If the lion cub stayed the same, it would get more and more probable that one of their play sessions would leave him seriously hurt. She didn't plan on relenting Simba's torment, but she didn't want to kill him accidentally. He was part of the hippo family now, so it was time he started acting more like them. "So, what are we going to do now?" Simba piped up, catching Michelle in the middle of her train of thought.

"You know, I was just thinking about that." Michelle had a mischievous glint in her eyes as she spoke. "I'm glad that you enjoyed your 'dessert' earlier, but I'm willing to bet that you have a craving for some real protein, huh?" Simba gently prodded at his hippo milk-filled stomach, the slightly distended spear swaying ever so gently as Michelle trekked across the Savannah. He was full, but the prospect of a proper lion's meal made the fullness go away to a point. Sheepishly, he nodded to his 'mother,' prompting a hearty chuckle from her.

Just as luck would have it, Michelle noticed a gentle, resulting in the long grass to the left to her, most likely one of the many smaller animals that made their home in the Pride Lands. Usually, something that little would barely be considered a snack to the hippo...but Simba would have to start somewhere. The enormous fat beast stopped in her tracks towards Pride Rock, and with practiced grace despite her bulky size, jumped up into the air over where she saw the grass move, nearly throwing her new son off her shoulder.

"Gah!" A high-pitched voice rang out from underneath the rapidly growing shadow of Michelle's descending form before an earth-shattering boom rang out as she landed ass-first into the ground. The owner of the voice was pinned to the underside of the hippo's thick thigh, a female meerkat who pounded her fists helplessly against the Earth, pleading for release. "Please, g-get off of me, I can't breathe!"

"Mommy, what are you doing?" Simba asked with growing dread as he observed his second mother oblige the meerkat's request, wriggling her fingers around her as she raised the small mongoose higher and higher into the air. "If you're going to eat her, can you-mph, MMMPH!?" Before the lion cub could finish his sentence, the hippo cut him off by forcefully inserting the imprisoned meerkat into his open maw. The little lion flailed and squirmed against Michelle's advances, but there was no stopping her; she pushed more and more of the meerkat into his head, forcing him to start swallowing so that he wouldn't choke.

Michelle kept a steady, constant smile as Simba enveloped more and more of the meerkat's body, her torso slick with lion spittle as he tried to breathe and swallow at the same time. The only thing that mitigated against the intense confusion that he was in...was the unanticipated cornucopia of taste dancing on his tastebuds as he took in his first living prey. If lions tasted like cherries and salt, meerkats tasted like pork and paprika, and onions and mushrooms and apples! He tried not to, but the lion cub couldn't help but smile at the waves of pleasure his tongue was sending to his brain.

The meerkat was soon only a pair of legs kicking without an aim in the air, Michelle no longer having to support her body as Simba now was brining her down of his own accord. The lion cub's already bloated belly inflated further as the meerkat entered headfirst into a slurry of acid and milk. But no matter how hard she screamed, no matter how hard she kicked her feet, she was already past the point of no return. Finally, with a sloppy slurp, the last of the meerkat's paws disappeared from the world, never to be seen again, and Simba was left a panting mess.

Soon, however, the horror of what he had just done dawned on him. "Oh...oh m-my god..." he moaned as he pawed his now strained gut, a wince of pain and pleasure from being so full ringing out from where he prodded. "I can feel her move inside...it huuuurts...!" The lion cub rolled onto his back atop Michelle's broad shoulder as best he could, trying to alleviate the pressure on his stomach.

Oh wow, I guess I kind of forgot what it was like the time I had my first prey..." Michelle cooed, gently lifting the cub down from her shoulder to a more comfortable spot atop her blubbery bosom. Simba had a proper potbelly, with the meerkat inside punching little bumps against his stretched, furred skin. "Here, this is a trick my mom did with me when I had a tummyache~."

Simba attempted to push the encroaching hippo snout away as it approached his distended stomach. Because of her, he was now in the process of digesting someone alive, what could she possibly do right now to make him feel better? But despite his mistrust, there was a lot that she could do to help him. First, she gave the distended stomach a small, short kiss. It didn't do much, but it tickled and put a smile on the cub's face through the pain.

Then, Michelle began to rock that stomach back and forth, the meerkat inside getting soaked in digestive juice, only stopping when she was rendered unconscious from the lack of fresh air. Finally, the hippo began massaging her lion son's stomach thoroughly, soothing the taut skin underneath his fur while he groaned in restrained pleasure from the treatment.

"There you go, Kitten. Feel better?" Michelle stopped after a while, the little cat in between the valley of her breasts rapidly losing energy as he began working down on the most enormous meal he ever ate. He mewled like a lost alley cat in the rain, nodding wordlessly to Michelle's query. "Good...how did she taste?"

"A-amazing...but I wish you would have warned me, I almost choked." Blood rushed to Simba's cheeks as he relented how he felt about his meal. There was a great deal of shame in delighting in how good another living thing tasted, but there was no denying that he enjoyed what his second mother did to him. What would Timon think of him know? "Am I...going to have to eat more meerkats?" He asked with both anticipation and terror.

"Kitten, now that your apart of the family, you're going to be eating a lot more than just small-time like that," Michelle smirked.

What happens next?

1. Michelle takes Simba to Rafiki to see if he can speed up her son's 'hippofication'.

2. At Pride Rock, Henriette wants to play with Simba

3. At Pride Rock, Timon And Pumpa are asking where they can find there friend

4. Time Skip A Month. The Pride Lands have changed, and the hippos have gotten bigger...

5. Free Choice!
1342412221121121321435132.title: Like Mother, Like Son

choices: Simba becomes as big and fat as Michelle
Simba turns into a fully grown hippo
13424122211211213214351321.content:
As the hippo and cub got closer to Pride Rock Michelle opted to take a small detour. Simba followed along, but was curious to know why they weren't going home. It didn't take long for him to recognize the familiar tree they were moving towards. The wide trunk of the baobab that housed Rafiki was all too distinct. A shiver ran down the lion's spine. He could really do without more of his friends getting exposed to these voracious hippos. He was all the more surprised to see the monkey greet them with the same elated voice he always had.

"Good afternoon, how are you two today?"

"Uh..." Simba was still lost for words. Had Rafiki not heard of what happened in Pride Rock? How could he be so casual with the hippo?

"We're fine, thanks." Michelle replied curtly. She looked over to the dumbstruck lion and rolled her eyes. "Maybe a bit full on food, but otherwise fine." She added with a chuckle.

"ah hah ha. I see... And what carries you to my humble home?"

"I would like your help with my son."

"Your son? And where is he?" The mandrill asked, curious about the situation.

"Right there." Michelle pointed at the cub, who finally stammered out an awkward greeting.

"The lion?" Rafiki's voice was filled with confusion. But before the hippo could elaborate on her adoption he shrugged and nodded. "Very well, what about him?"

"I'm trying to make him big and strong like myself. Because well... look at him. He's adorable, but he's not that much to look at. And I know that in a couple of years he might be a bit bigger, but well..."

"...you want more? Ah hah ha ha, you hippos, always vying to be the biggest. Rule of the roundest belly, right? But when your little son is all big and grown up, will he still be the cute little thing you adopted?"

Michelle smiled happily. It was strange for Simba to see. Normally there was always an air of glee or malice about her smile, but right now she seemed genuinely just cheerful.

"Oh, he'll always be my cute little thing. Now can you help me or not?"

"Ha ha ha, you presume much of my abilities, but I can guide you on the path like a fly zooming across a pond." Rafiki said with a smirk.

"What?" Michelle's brow furrowed with annoyance.

"Bring him here." The monkey extended a hand to Simba, the hippo giving him a fierce nod prompting the cub to approach them. As the little lion raised his paw to give to Rafiki, the mandrill reached further and put his hand on Simba's head.

"Ah, I see you're already trying to speed things up yourself." He mused to the hippo. Michelle huffed a little, her patience wearing thin. Rafiki turned his attention to Simba, looking him in the eyes. "Yes, I can see big things in your future. But a future tomorrow is as distant as a future three years away."

"Three years? I came here because I thought you could deliver me something better than waiting three years."

"Ha ha ha, and you think I can not?" The monkey joked, tapping the hippo on the head with his staff. Michelle let out an irritated growl, but he seemed unfazed by her anger. Instead he went into his home. The sounds of vigorous rummaging around could be heard and a minute later he came back with a small fruit.

"That's it?" the hippo huffed.

"Big things come in the smallest packages. Especially when they've got to fit in an overstuffed belly." He replied with a laugh. He gave Simba the fruit, the cub straining to eat it. He felt stuffed and even though the meerkat had stopped wriggling in his belly, it did little to diminish his bloated gut. It didn't help that the fruit tasted as dry and old as Rafiki himself. Michelle looked on with baited breath, but nothing happened.

"Well, now what?" She huffed. Rafiki tapped her on the head again and a second piece of the same fruit was left balanced on her large snout. The hippo bristled for a moment, her patience reaching its last straw with the annoying monkey. Simba was the only reason she'd humoured him so far. She did what she does best with food and scarfed it down, practically inhaling the little piece of fruit.

"Now you wait a minute and you'll no longer have to look down to see your son." Rafiki mused, smiling broadly and taking a few steps back. He held onto his staff and watched with rapt attention. No matter how this would end, it would no doubt be amusing.
13424122211211213214351321.title: They grow up so fast

choices: Simba ransacks Rafiki's tree for food
Sarabi hears all this and demands to see Simba
At Pride Rock, the hippos welcome their newest member
In the future, how do the Pride Lands look like?
134241222112112132143513212.content:
As the pieces of fruit that Simba and Michelle ate entered into their stomachs, they begin to link up with each other through whatever arcane energy Rafiki had doused them with, like two parts of a puzzle coming together. The lion cub's fruit received what the hippo's fruit gave, and as it melted away with the acid, milk, and assorted bits of Meerkat, his body absorbed it with unusual eagerness. The pachyderm's adopted son went wide-eyed as his body involuntarily spasmed, wave upon wave of pure, enchanted energy coursing through his veins. But he wasn't in pain, the widening smile on his face could attest to that. Whatever the fruit was doing to him, it felt good.

"Ahh... what's ha-happening to me..." Simba half moaned and giggled, a firm, warm sensation enveloping his whole being before the first changes became apparent to Rafiki and Michelle. With a series of soft popping sounds, the lion shifted away from being a quadruped to a biped, his two front paws becoming more dexterous while his hind legs became his legs. Tongue lolling out from his mouth as he lay stomach up, it was apparent to see that his already distended belly was further ballooning outwards. Soft, supple blubber piled layer upon layer of warmth for its new host, his lithe legs turning to trunks and prominent man-boobs growing on his chest. "M-more...more!" The thickening lion cried out in joy.

"How much more is he going to get?" Michelle finally spoke up, hoping that Rafiki was able to cast light on Simba's transformation. She was glad that the monkey's shenanigans weren't a waste of her time, but as the lion grew up and out in weight and height, she was naturally curious as to what he'll look like once his little mutation was over. "Don't get me wrong, I'm all for what's happening to him, but...what exactly is happening to him?"

"As I said earlier, you will wait until you no longer have to look down to see your son, remember?" The Mandrill chuckled at Michelle's questions. Meanwhile, just as much as Simba was gaining weight, he was losing fur. For every pound of fat and muscle put in place along with his lengthening skeleton, his fluffy hair received by an inch — patches of yellow and cream fuzz fall, revealing pinkish-grey skin shining brilliantly in the savannah sun. "And that's how much more he'll get, until your face to face with the child you want to see."

And Michelle wasn't interested in looking at her son as a lowly lion; she wanted a Simba that had the same hunger, desires, and needs as someone like her does. Sarabi was in for a shock when she eventually left the hippo's stomach because her flesh and blood was rapidly looking more and more like Pride Rock's gluttonous invaders. The lion cub groaned and moaned in ecstasy as his feline tail shortened to a stub, his buttocks just underneath inflating like beach balls. His muzzle broadens, his ears reorient, and with his newly formed hands, he feels up and down his growing body. In time, the cub turning hippo begins to stand up, wobbling at first, unsure of how to balance his increasing heft.

Michelle yelps in surprise as Simba falls forward against her torso for support, his eyes full of ecstasy and amazement. "Is this...is this what it's like for you, all the time?" He queries the longer established hippo genuinely curious, slowly growing in height from his eyes at her waist to her naval. His cheeks looked like they had two full meerkats stuffed in each one, more and more coming off from his body, revealing the pachyderm he was becoming. "Always so big and soft, and big and powerful and...and hungry?" A soft growl escaped from his ballooning tummy.

A wide smile appears on Michelle's face as she takes in the lion-hippo's questions. "Yep, and it never stops kiddo. Remember what I said earlier today? We're only going to get bigger, hungrier, heavier, and needier. Do you know what it means to have power like that?" She pets the slowly growing Simba on his head, tufts of fur coming apart at her touch. She was afraid that his cuteness would evaporate as the changes went, but in a way, he looked almost more adorable now. He still retained his youthful spark, his eyes wide with wonder and innocence. "And now that you're like us, so will you." To that, Simba surprised his adopted mother by rapping his plump arms around her side as his head brushed her bosom.

"Thank you, mommy." Simba buried his head into the same orbs he drank milk from earlier. Michelle blinked at how he addressed her as his mother; it was the first time it didn't sound forced or unnatural. His new hippo tail wagged happily behind him while Michelle hugged her son back, Rafiki watching the scene unfold with amusement. "I can't wait to be just like you..."

Simba did not have to wait very long. Soon, his transformation from a sweet and adorable lion cub into a fat, greedy hippopotamus was nearing completion. It was hard to think that he ever looked anything remotely related to a cat, his once thin and fluffy torso now the size of a barrel, his legs and arms as thick as tree trunks, his maw big enough to fit five of his old self in with ease. And true to the Mandrill's words, the growth only stopped when the two pachyderms were at eye level with each other. Michelle, who couldn't be happier with how her Simba's metamorphosis played out, gave her son a lick-kiss across his newly cherubic face.

"So, now that the change has been completed, there is now the small matter of payment." Rafiki ruined the tender scene by clearing his voice and announcing to the two hippos that his service was not for free. "That fruit that I gave you was far from cheap, but since this is a family affair, you can have...say, two years working as my assistant?" Michelle blinked, confusion, and rage boiling up inside her as the Mandrill calmly stated that her Simba was now his. But before she could have a chance to enact her fury, the former lion cub turned around to face him instead.

"Oh, I'll have more than that." He licked his lips greedily.

"Really? I dunno, even for you that might be- Woah what hey-!!" With a quickness utterly uncharacteristic of someone his size, Simba had set his massive body into motion and lunged forward. Before Rafiki could react, the new hippo had snatched a lively treat in his hands. Michelle gasped in shock, Simba had the Mandrill firmly trapped in his clutches, holding him like a simple sandwich. He squirmed valiantly, but that only tightened his iron grip around his waist. "Hey, hey! What do you think you're doing!?"

Simba's answer was a smug grin and a dramatized lick of his lips. With that, he opened his mouth wide and immediately Rafiki into his hungry maw. He was given no chance to plead. No time to react. No way to even realize what the former lion thought of him until it was far too late. He was allowed mere moments for his mind to catch up to what was happening to him while Simba took the opportunity to savor his taste. He tilted his head up and sealed the Mandrill's fate with a single swallow.

As Rafiki slid down Simba's neck, he traced a claw along with the bulging outline of his form, easing it down his gullet. Until finally, he slipped out of sight and was forever lost within her enormous belly. Michelle suddenly felt dizzy; it had all happened too fast. Her son had shown that his mind had evolved along with his body in the transformation. A childhood friend meant less to the new hippo than the whims of his appetite.

Michelle couldn't have been more proud.

"You turned out to be a greedy little thing, huh, kitten?" Michelle walked up behind Simba to give the new hippo an embrace, catching him by surprise. "Only a real hippo could do what you just did. How do you feel?"

"Mphrf...hungry." Simba smiled, rubbing his stomach idly. Rafiki didn't even make a bulge from the outside. He gave out the hippopotamus equivalent of a purr as he felt Michelle's blubber crest into his back, rapidly forgetting the torment she and her family put in through or at least seeing them in a new light. And with that, Simba the hippo was born.
134241222112112132143513212.title: Coming Into The Family

choices: Simba eats the hyenas and the gazelles
1342412221121121321435132122.content:
Michelle had felt the older lion's protests in her belly. Kicking and shoving against the unyielding walls. Even some muffled shouting, though the hippo had no idea what was actually being said, her insulating blubber nearly muting it alltogether. The lioness had probably caught as little of what was going on outside, but her conclusions were that her son was in peril. The hippo couldn't wait to show her that the opposite was true. And now that Simba had transformed, she wouldn't be able to interfere in their plans.

Sarabi's frantic struggles finally paid off. It seemed like the fat beast was too annoyed with her to keep her down any longer. The stomach walls around her closed in, squeezing her through the narrow tube. She was getting real tired of being taken in and out of Michelle's belly, but this was the only way she could watch over Simba. Soon the wet tunnel was replaced with dry air as she fell to the ground. The lioness shook her head, wiping the worst of the hippo's stomach juices from her face. In front of her was another hippo, but this one seemed... odd.

"What do you want?" She spoke coldly.

"Mom?" The hippo replied, his baritone voice sounding familiar.

"S... Simba?" She stammered, her eyes widening in horror as she tried to wrap her head around what happened. This mountain of lard had her son's voice. "What's going on here?" She added, sounding increasingly distressed.

"It's okay, mom. I'm fine. Mommy Michelle helped me be as big and beautiful as her. Now I don't have to worry about being eaten anymore." He tried to reassure her, but Simba's words could only do so much for a mother whose son had suddenly gotten much bigger and stronger than herself. The former cub struggled to convey his message too. His instincts were pushing him to see the scared lioness at his feet as little more than food.

"Awww... I love happy reunions!" Michelle cheered insincerely. She was up to something, Sarabi could tell.

"But you know what would be even greater? How about you show your mommy how big you really are? You can carry her around now, like I do." She mused aloud, seeing a sly grin creep up on Simba's face.

Sarabi was shocked by the hippo's bluntness, but far more surprised when she felt her son grab her by the scruff of her neck. The level of ease with which he lifted her up in the air was terrifying. This was supposed to be her happy little boy, not some fat monster about to eat her. The lioness was hoisted up high, held dangling over the cavernous chasm of the hippo's maw. Simba's belly rumbled almost on command. There was nothing more she could say or do to stop this. Without hesitation he pushed her headfirst down his gullet. The tight flesh grabbed hold of its prey. Sarabi fought off her natural urges to resist, not wanting to hurt her son. From one fleshy prison to another, the lioness was starting to feel awfully bored by sliding through hippo throats into big, hollow bellies.

Simba shivered with joy as he felt the large morsel travelling through him. An entire lion, down in one go. And yet, his hunger remained. He turned to Michelle, who was eager to lay her hands on his belly. Inside she could feel the weak squirming of two animals the cub had called family not too long ago. His transformation into part of his new family was coming along nicely. But as she stood there daydreaming and rubbing her son's gut, Simba surprised her with a suggestion.

"Mommy? Can I go out to the plains to get some food. My belly is all big now, but also still empty." His stomach grumbled again.

"Empty? I just watched you eat that dumb monkey and your own mother."

"Okay, mostly empty. Can I? Please?" The former cub whined, his low voice making his childish mewling sound all the more pathetic. Michelle just shrugged in response. He was a hippo now, how much trouble could he get himself in? Anything he couldn't eat he was now strong enough to crush into submission.

"Fine, just be back at Pride Rock before sunset. I want everyone to meet the newest addition to our family!" She said cheerfully, watching as the cub walked into the plains to start his voracious rampage. A tear welled up in her eye. She'd not felt this proud before in her life.

Simba walked around with a confident stride. Where most of the beasts in the Savannah would've given him trouble before, now they'd better mind their own business or there would be more passengers in his gut. When he was well out of earshot, the former cub began talking to himself.

"Okay, you two, stay calm. I've nearly got you out of here." He said, his voice still somewhat hushed just in case. The squirming in his belly subsided, but only a little. Another few minutes of walking passed and Simba was now certain the hippos wouldn't be able to see what was about to happen.

Sarabi and Rafiki got squeezed together as the large stomach around them contracted to expel the two. A short trip later they were spat out right next to a small pond. They looked up to the fat monster, betrayal in their eyes. But before they could throw accusations at him, Simba falls to his knees and apologises.

"I'm sorry I put you in my belly. But it was the only thing I could think of doing to get you out of there. Mom, it's not safe for you around those hippos. I love you, but I'm with them now. I'll be sure to visit you lots, but your little cub has grown up... literally I guess."

Simba struggled to string together his words, but suddenly he felt a reassuring paw on his belly.

"Oh Simba. I don't know what happened or how..." The cub turned hippo looked up to see Rafiki looking away and feigning innocence. "...but you'll always be my little boy. Promise me you'll be good." She said, trying not to cry in front of her son. But the waterworks had already started in his eyes. He grabbed her and lifted her into an overwhelming hug. Sarabi sank halfway into the soft blubber of her son. It hadn't stopped being surreal yet to have him be a hippo now, but at least he still had the kindness in him from before.

"And Rafiki... What were you thinking asking Michelle of all people to pay you? You're lucky I intervened or she would've done much worse to you."

"Ah hah ha ha, do not threaten me with a good time." The mandrill chattered, earning him a confused look from both lion and hippo.

"Anyway, you're safe now. I'm gonna get something to eat and head over to Pride Rock. You should try to find the other lions that were smart enough to run away. I don't know when or how, but I'm gonna try and make this right." Simba stated.

"Just be careful, son. Even as big as you are, don't believe there aren't any dangers anymore for you." Sarabi replied, sounding as motherly as she ever did. The cub turned hippo smiled at her, squeezing her into his fatty chest one last time before setting her back down on the ground.

With his friends safe the cub could get on with his original plan. He was a hippo now, and the deep-seated urge to feast was ever present. It was hard for him not to gobble his mom and Rafiki right up again after letting them out. They felt so great filling his belly. But the cub stayed ahead of his instincts. It did leave his belly empty and the hippo was ravenous for a meal. He wandered around, hoping to find a nice opportunity when he heard screams coming from the other side of some boulders. There it was, the meal he was looking for.

As the hippo rounded the corner he saw what was going on. Before him were a small family of gazelles being harassed by two hyenas. The lithe herbivores were shaking on their legs as the menacing brutes closed in.

"Who should we eat? I think the chubby one."

"Chubby? They're all skins and bones. I wish there was a chubby one."

"You looking for chubby?" The cub turned hippo said, introducing himself to the scene with a hungry smile.
1342412221121121321435132122.title: Sarabi hears all this and demands to see Simba

choices: Simba makes the gazelles massage him
Simba playfully squishes the two gazelles
The sun begins to set, and the parents aren't back yet.
13424122211211213214351321221.content:
Before Sarabi left with Rafiki from the Pride Lands, she asked Simba to promise her that he would be good. The older lion could see the hunger in the cub turned hippo's eyes, and she knew that even as he hugged her against his newly thickened chest, a good portion of his brain was telling him she was nothing more than food. But though there was nothing that the mother could do about her son becoming a pachyderm, she hoped she could stop him from acting like one. Perhaps a few words of motherly advice would help drown out the more carnal desires to eat everything and everyone indiscriminately. But as Simba looked down at the hyenas and gazelles, the only thing he could think about how much bigger he might get after he was done digesting them all.

The hyena that complained about his prey not having enough meat on their bones was the first to turn around to face the intruder's voice, prepared to attack before realizing just who was speaking. The other hyena turned after that, dropped its jaw in horror, and began to back away in fear. Yet Simba was not in the mood for a chase. Testing his newfound power, he let out a smirk and leaped into the air onto the escaping brute before it could get too far. Crashing down belly first onto the Savannah floor, the hyena let out a howl of pain as the hippo's weight crushed the air out of his lungs.

"What's wrong, little guy? I thought you wanted a meal with some fat on them?" Simba chuckled as he observed the pinned hyena flail in the vein, unable to breathe with the cub turned hippo's stomach flesh obstructing his mouth. The colossal pachyderm moaned as he felt his soon to be food wriggle against his torso; it was like a massage only much more intense. Now he understood why Henriette and Michelle liked to squash him when he was still a lion cub; it felt amazing. "Lucky for me, I'm much less picky~." With no further foreplay, Simba forced the struggling hyena out from his vice grip and plunged him quickly into his drooling maw.

The Hyena that Simba left unattended was entirely opposed to his friend becoming hippo food, so without time for thinking, he threw himself against the intruder's thigh in an angry rage, attempting to sink its teeth into his blubbery hide. Unfortunately for the hyena, this did nothing save for tickling the hippo as he shoved his friend down his esophagus, his skin was too thick to be pierced like that, it seems. As soon as he was done with the first snack, he plucked the biting hyena off from the side of his leg and lifted him into the air. The gazelles that Simba 'saved' watched in increasing horror as both of their harassers were swallowed whole by this gluttonous stranger. Tracing the last of the hyena down his throat, Simba turned his attention to the family of antelopes; a mother, a father, and two kids.

The father of the gazelles, hopeful that the rather gluttonous stranger helped them out because of good intentions, nervously walked up to Simba with a gracious smile. "T-thank you, good sir...I think if you didn't show up, it would be us that would be stewing away, not them." The lion cub turned hippo, his hunger somewhat sated, had enough self-control to not grab the approaching antelope up into his maw followed by the rest of his family, but he would be lying if he said he wasn't tempted. "Is there anything we can do to repay you?"

Simba's stomach let out a powerful growl as it impatiently reminded its host that it was no way near full. The hippo smiled and affectionately slapped the great ball of fat and muscle, making it bounce and quiver right in front of the father's face. "Well, do you know where I can find some more food? Those two hyenas were alright, I guess, but I don't see anymore around, and I'm starving!" Simba chuckled as he saw the male adult gazelle's smile grow more strained, obviously realizing he and his family wasn't out of danger just yet. "Hey, I have a perfect idea! Why should I go to the food when you can just bring it to me? That sounds like a fair trade for saving your lives, right?"

"U-uh...r-right! Well, what would you like us to get? There are some fruit bushes near where we usually graze, or..." The father of the gazelles slowly stopped talking as he saw Simba's big hand come descending onto his form. He didn't even try to resist as he was lifted into the air up against his savior's broad muzzle, grinning greedily as the hippo eyed his form. "...pl-please don't eat me." He whimpered, his wife shielding the kids away from the scene as best she could.
